qas.question: Which representative criticized the the State Department investigation?
The representative said that inspectors had been show what sort of villages?
Which NGO investigated the Chinese program in 2005?
What sort of techniques did the State Department conclude were still being employed by China?
Which representative helped the the State Department investigation the most?
The representative said that inspectors had never seen what sort of villages?
What sort of techniques did the State Department conclude were never employed by China?
Which NGO investigated the Chinese program in 2002?

context: Rep. <a0_0><b5_0>Christopher H. Smith<b5_0/><a0_0/> (R-NJ), criticized the State Department investigation, saying the investigators were shown "<a1_0><b6_0>Potemkin Villages<b6_0/><a1_0/>" where residents had been intimidated into lying about the family-planning program. <a2_0><b7_0>Dr. Nafis Sadik<b7_0/><a2_0/>, former director of UNFPA said her agency had been pivotal in reversing China's coercive population control methods, but a 2005 report by <a3_0><b9_0>Amnesty International<b9_0/><a3_0/> and a separate report by the United States State Department found that <a4_0><b8_0>coercive techniques<b8_0/><a4_0/> were still regularly employed by the Chinese, casting doubt upon Sadik's statements.
